title: 2026 Super Bowl: Tom Brady is gone, but the New England Patriots are back
subhead: Led by young quarterback Drake Maye, who hopes to follow in the footsteps of the former NFL star, the New England franchise returns to the American football championship game on Sunday to face the Seattle Seahawks.

title: UN prepares convention on crimes against humanity
Epstein affair: Keir Starmer's chief of staff resigns over Mandelson appointment
Japan's ruling party on track for an overwhelming majority in snap legislative elections
subhead: While final results are not expected until Monday, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent hailed what he called a 'big victory' for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.

title: Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
subhead: After initially denouncing what it described as 'fake outrage' from the media, the presidential administration eventually blamed the post on President Donald Trump's Truth Social account on an unidentified staffer's mistake and deleted it.

title: Thailand's conservative prime minister defies expectations to win general election
subhead: Many observers had expected the People's Party to prevail. Its leader, Natthaphong Ruengpanyawut, conceded defeat.

title: At Centre Pompidou-Metz, the late resurrection of sculptor Louise Nevelson
subhead: The American artist, known in the 1960s for her monumental and forbidding installations, is on display at the Moselle museum.

In Haiti, the transitional presidential council hands over power to PM Alix Dider Fils-Aimé
Bruno Retailleau, a hardline conservative ready to run for French president
'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
subhead: Europe continues to struggle to find its own voice on the international stage because it remains trapped in a cognitive dependence on Washington, writes Rosa Balfour, director of the Carnegie Europe think tank.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
subhead: Millions of emails released by the US Department of Justice reveal the financier's relationships, some more intense than others, with several figures from France's politics and culture.

title: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
